wikipedia_page.main: Francis James Patrick Lilley (24 July 1907 – 21 August 1971) was a British civil engineering company chairman and politician.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1959 United Kingdom general election

response: Dame Katharine Elliot had been given a life peerage in 1958 and so at the 1959 general election, a new Unionist candidate was chosen. Frank Lilley proved an able campaigner and The Times corresponded noted "subtle undercurrents of religion" in the constituency."Glasgow in the Melting-Pot", The Times, 7 October 1959. Lilley ended up winning the seat by 1,101 votes.

link_mentions.page: Index of World War II articles (F)

response: *Frank Lilley (1883-1939) - founder of Lilley Construction Company
